description: This is beautiful and thank you to the creator of this software. I found I had to test test a few speech modulators to find the right one. But that is normal because there is no one size fits all for human speech. It works beautifully. Good Job. Keep up the great work. I'm a proud Fedora User.  Awesome. Just Awesome.

It is brilliant, please keep up the great work.
Just right now (4.5), some strange thing happenes:
It works and 'burns' your CPU ;-)
until you install the AddOn... (AMD / NVIDIA)
But then it keeps telling: Error, could not initialize TTS, if one tries to use whisper TTS or CoquiXTTS
Even removing the Addon again will not fix the error anymore.

Tried it on multiple machines (AMD / NVIDIA)
All manjaro linux and kernel 6.9

Any idea?!
summary: Works, until AMD/NVIDIA Addon is installed

description: absolutely great for exporting text to audio

I have been using the Text-to-Speech app for some time now, and I must say, it has exceeded all my expectations! This app is an absolute game-changer, and it has become an indispensable tool in my daily routine.
Unusable. Will wait for an updated version. Uninstalling for now.

This is a GREAT program - but it needs a fairly muscle bound computer to run it fluently.

The speech processing is excellent.

I have wanted a program LIKE THIS, to convert LONG documents, like 300 or 400+ pages, into audio MP3's to listen too while I close my eyes and put my feet up on the desk, or do other things.

This is a very good program... and it's well sorted.

Most complex documents, when converted to plain TXT files, with most of the extraneous information edited out, aside from page numbers, it works very well.

It's an excellent job on the software actually.
summary: I think this is pretty damned good actually

description: Why do none of these text to speech apps work off line?
It doesn't work and automatically set itself as default music player.
TTS works ok but nothing on STT. Listens and then just...nothing.

A solid experience overall : Many speech-to-text AND text-to-speech models, easily installable straight from the menu. Some of them offer great results. Almost no configuration is required from the user. 

What could be better : The GUI could be more beautifull, and keyboard shortcuts could be improved. The user cannot add voices nor models by themself.

In conclusion, this is the easiest way i found to use TTS an STT on my linux, low specs, machine. The flatpak install makes it wonderfully easy.

Both, text to speech and speech to text works great and for free. It's very nice tool and simple to use.

The UI could use a bit of improvement. E.g. on large window it's a bit difficult to see which download button is for which language option.

This application is really useful because it opens up access to basic speech recognition models for a wide audience. If you can click a few buttons and yell near your microphone, then this will work well for you.

I've been hunting for a local TTS similar to macOS. Not sure how I missed this one in my 2+ years of searching, but stumbled on it while looking for GPU drivers. I love how easy downloading models is (something I've tried and failed miserably to do in the past), the easy and persistent speed selection, and the accessibility with keyboard mapping. I kind of wish copying selected text to the clipboard could be part of the worflow so I don't need to do Ctrl+C and then the binding I set for reading, but hey, if we're getting to this point of nitpicking, I'm ecstatic.
I've been looking for a reasonable TTS solution on Linux for years. The ability to use it offline is a huge bonus! Many thanks.

Version 4.4.0 was easy to set up, the UI is basic but fine. Output quality is incredible, especially as it's free, but some engines are slow.

The choice of different engines for English is overwhelming. It would be nice to have some default or suggested options for a quick start (or even just a paragraph in the readme with recommendations) and more filtering options (e.g. to view just what you've downloaded). I needed to enable GPU acceleration in Flatseal, otherwise it would crash if tried to activate that just in app settings.
This is absolute magic! Thank you Michal. if we can integrate local LLM models to do summarisation etc. I would love to contribute (money, not code )

for any one useing this i think it is grate
 but what is the best text to speech thare are so many its hard to pic
It works perfectly. If you need GPU acceleration, download the flatpak extensions for AMD or NVIDIA gpus.

The Best Text to Speech app I have ever found on Linux! The only downside is for whatever reason whenever I use it, the app keeps running off my CPU instead of the GPU even though I installed the AMD ROCm addon and the app sees it installed and selected it.
summary: Finally a Text-to-speech that doesn't sound like its from the 80s!

description: Sadly, because of dnote crashing, Speech Note won't even launch.
Listen to text with privacy and human voices

Vielen Dank. Jetzt ist Whisper für Leute, die nicht so gut oder gern tippen (auch Behinderte mit eingeschränkter Hand-Funktion) einfach und zuverlässig verfügbar.
Und das lokal auf dem Computer, ohne dass Google &Co mitlesen!
Es sind außer Whisper auch Deep-Speech und andere Modelle verfügbar.
Das beste was auf Linux verfügbar ist!

Eine sehr einfache und schlichte aber funktionale Benutzeroberfläche mit überraschend guten TTS-, Übersetzer- und STT-Modellen. Dass alles offline so gut funktioniert, hat mich so begeistert, dass ich schon Stunden nur ins Testen gesteckt habe und ich bin immernoch beeindruckt, dass ich mit ein Paar mausklicks out-of-the-box selbst whisper large (wenn auch sehr langsam) auf meinem alten ThinkPad zum laufen kriege. Auch ist es einfach eine Tolle Schnittstelle um verschiedene Modelle zusammenzubringen

Bin begeistert von der guten "Speech to Text" und "Text to Speech"Funktion. Die Übersetzer-Funktion habe ich bisher noch nicht getestet...
Danke den Entwicklern!

I am actually surprised there are GUI tools for Linux for this kind of task. More surprisingly it works well and the UI does not bug out. AND it can make use of your GPU no matter if running AMD or nVidia. As long as the speech model supports it ofc. Good job!

J'ai essayé les modèles français de Whisper Large et Small ainsi que Vosk Small. Vosk Small ne travaille pas bien. Il cherche plus des syllabes que des mots. Ceci donne des mots scindés en deux qui ne veulent rien dire et qu'il faut corriger (perte de temps importante). 
Whisper Large est très lourd malgré mes 16GB de RAM. Il faut une machine puissante pour les modèles larges. Cependant la reconnaissance des mots est correct (évidemment pas parfaite, mais pas moins que des solutions payantes qui ont une plus value sur le mode dictée). Whisper Small convient tout à fait. Son temps de traitement est raisonnable et l'orthographe est aussi acceptable que le modèle large.
En plus j'apprécie la reconnaissance à partir d'un fichier audio, c'est une fonction intéressante pour retranscrire les paroles qu'on enregistre sur téléphone (sur mon Samsung Android c'est beaucoup moins bien en qualité de retranscription).
Si ce n'est pas révolutionnaire c'est une bonne qualité. Bien meilleure que la reconnaissance vocale Google dans mon cas.
summary: Bonne qualité pour de l'open source [UBUNTU 20.04.6 LTS 64bits]

description: The app is crashing, anything I clic makes the window vanishing
Programme simple d'utilisation qui permet de faire de la transcription de qualité (relecture humaine toujours nécessaire) en local.
summary: Super implémentation d'IA générative pour la transcription

description: Модель Coqui XTTS-v2.0.3 / ru позволяет скопировать голос из короткого фрагмента и озвучивать им текст. Получается не идеально конечно, но довольно интересно пробовать загружать разные фрагменты и смотреть с каким из них лучше озвучка.
